//notes: Titegroup is a flattened ball propellant
Titegroup fits for standard-pressure (not +P or +P+) loads
description: Ball propellant (commonly known as gunpowder or smokeless powder) with a very-high burn rate.  Higher burn rates are better-suited for shorter barrels and lighter bullets; they also positively affect accuracy.  However, they're only suited for pistol calibers: heavier rifle bullets require a slower burn over a longer barrel in order to reach their potential.  This propellant can be loaded into a cartridge

notes: diameter is of a single large-ish ball-propellant grain
~46 propellant balls at density 1.086 g/cm3 to make 0.1 gr
volume is for 70 000 'units' of 0.1 gr of the powder ≈ 1 lb
